name: Julián Urbano
content: Julián Urbano | Assistant Professor in Computer Science Julián Urbano Assistant Professor in Computer Science Home Research Publications Professional Service Teaching Projects Software and Data Awards and Honors Short Bio Julián Urbano Delft University of Technology Van Mourik Broekmanweg 6 - 5.E280 2628 XE Delft The Netherlands +31 15 27 86176 j.urbano@tudelft.nl urbano.julian@gmail.com News 30 Jul 2020: Looks like I got tenure! 09 Jul 2020: Music Tempo Estimation: Are We Done Yet? accepted in the Transactions of ISMIR. 15 OCt 2019: Are Nearby Neighbors Relatives?: Testing Deep Music Embeddings accepted in Frontiers in Applied Mathematics and Statistics. 08 Aug 2019: Towards Stochastic Simulations of Relevance Profiles accepted to CIKM 2019. 08 Jun 2019: The AcousticBrainz Genre Dataset: Multi-Source, Multi-Level, Multi-Label, and Large-Scale, accepted to ISMIR 2019. 20 Apr 2019: Statistical Significance Testing in Information Retrieval: An Empirical Analysis of Type I, Type II and Type III Errors (full paper) and A New Perspective on Score Standardization (short paper), accepted to SIGIR 2019. 04 Mar 2019: Now up our new Lord of the rings paper: One Deep Music Representation to Rule Them All? : A Comparative Analysis of Different Representation Learning Strategies. 06 Feb 2019: Now up: Mapping by Observation: building a User-tailored Music Conducting System from Spontaneous Movements. 12 Nov 2018: Gave a talk to new PhD students at UNED: Your PhD and You. 15 Jun 2018: simIReff is now available from CRAN. 10 Jun 2018: Next Friday 15th June we are hosting a seminar about Trusted Data Analytics. 11 Apr 2018: New full paper accepted to SIGIR 2018: Stochastic Simulation of Test Collections: Evaluation Scores. © 2024 by Julián Urbano
